metadata.title: CVE-2022-23990 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.4 has an integer overflow in the doPrologfunction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-3
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-3
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-3').
xmlrpc-c package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
